name: Hotel Schloss Monchstein

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel Schloss Monchstein is without a doubt one of the best hotels we have stayed at : of course, the setting is gorgeous overlooking the city, the view at night is breathtaking and all the nature surrounding is perfect to rest. Only ten minutes away from the city center, the hotel staff will give you free elevator passes to come and go as you please.
reviews.title: A dream setting for a romantic week-end
One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in!
reviews.text: The rooms are simply magnificent, well decorated, squeaky-clean, luminous, spacious and we especially enjoyed the private terrasse.

But what really makes this hotel unforgettable is the kindness and professionalism of its staff who made us feel at home from the minute we arrived until we left. They were always available to answer any question, help us organize our day in Salzburg, made sure we had averything we could expect and more. The little notes they left for us in our room, the chocolates they brought up with our room service, the advice they gave on what to chose from the menu...everything was perfect and we will remember our stay for a very long time. A special bravo to the restaurant chef, the food was exquisite and we had the opportunity to eat in "the smallest restaurant of the world" in the hotel tower for our anniversary dinner...what else can we ask for ? TRUST US you can book a room at Hotel Schloss Monchstein and never regret it.
reviews.title: Dinner at the Restaurant of Hotel Schloss Monchstein

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a 5 star hotel, the prices remain reasonnable for the incredible experience you have.
reviews.title: Best stay ever

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights as part of our "delayed honeymoon" tour of Europe. This was by far our favorite hotel. Our room was perfect, very well appointed and with an outstanding view of Salzburg from our windows. The hotel staff were also excellent, very friendly and helpful - they couldn't have done more to make our stay a wonderful experience. I would also recommend dinner in the "smallest restaurant in the world," which is a romantic experience not to be missed! We will definitely stay again on our next visit to Austria.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of those hotels you rave about. We were there over Christmas 2012. The staff are some of the finest and most attentive we've ever had the pleasure of meeting. No request is too small. They never disappointed us with suggestions on where to eat, what to see, when to go, etc. The spa was SUPERB as was the spa staff. The rooms were beautiful and impeccable. This hotel is a definite return visit waiting to happen!
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here August 2012 - service and views from the hotel were outstanding. Without question 5 star quality - HOWEVER, if you are driving here (as we were) make sure to get clear, express directions to the hotel. The one way roads and ped-only parts near the city center make this a bit of a challenge to find, even using SavNat. But the place was great and location fantastic.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in Salzburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Where does one start?
reviews.title: Austrian Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Decor - Nothing short of regal.
reviews.title: We found our little piece of Austrian heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room - Amazing. Probably one of the nicest rooms I've ever had despite not having much of a view from it. Clean, spacious and obviously well maintained.
reviews.title: “Will definitely return when visiting Salzburg!”

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very conveniently situated outside the old town, so you can reach it without problem by car, and it is not far (just 300 meters) to the lift which takes you downtown. During Festival time the city center is closed to traffic from 10am to 2pm. The rooms seemingly are all different so we reserved a superior one. The one we were assigned, Nr 24, had a stunning view, a modern comfortable bathroom, but the room itself was too small for two persons. We kept being in each others way and hitting ourselves on the bed, the chair,etc. We had dinner twice at the restaurant and the meals and the service were excellent. Breakfast on the terrace with view of the city is lovely in good weather. The staff in general was very forthcoming. All in all we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel, but next time we would reserve a suite so as to be more comfortable in the room.
reviews.title: 5* HOTEL FAR FROM MADDING CROWDS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we did not stay at this hotel, we did venture up to it for breakfast. The offerings were extensive and all were superb.
reviews.title: Great place for breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated so that you can see out over Salzburg and the river. The views enhance the dining experience. If the weather permits, sit outside.
reviews.title: A 2 night stop in Salzburg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I spent 2 nights here on our 25th wedding anniversary trip around Europe. Everything about the hotel was great. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were treated so very well by every member of staff. We had a package that included dinner - what a special treat that was! We were fortunate that we had the restaurant to ourselves and therefore the undivided attention of the staff. Do eat there if you stay in this hotel. We had a luxurious room with a magnificent bathroom overlooking Salzburg. I had to request a fan as it was so very hot and the ac unit in the room was barely coping. The hotel provided us with the use of a ticket enabling us to used the lift down into the old town. My wife was pleased to see enormous Mozart chocolates on her bedside table each night
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

reviews.text: A great location away from the tourist centre. Very attentive and informative staff, excellent restaurant, Wolfgang will look after you. Highly recommended . Whilst the motel s away from town there is left tat rates you to the hub in several minutes,but the secluded location really adds to the reason to stay there.
reviews.title: exceeded expectations

reviews.text: I picked this hotel because I was driving through Salzburg and wanted a hotel with free car parking and away from the madding crowds of the city center. This hotel offers just that and a little more.
reviews.title: Old world charm at a high cost

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location of this property is excellent if you prefer to stay away from the city center. It takes a good 10 - 15 minutes to get to the city itself by foot aided by an elevator in the museum of modern art which is close by. However, walking through the quiet and dim road from the museum to the hotel can be a little disconcerting as the path is very secluded and a bit "scary". So it maybe good to take a taxi instead.
reviews.title: This is the hotel to blow your budget on

reviews.text: The hotel used to be some sort of castle or mansion, perched on top of a hillside overlooking one side of the city of Salzburg. As it is an old building, you have to expect a somewhat old world charm to this hotel. The room we got was large, but clearly in need of some renovations such as new flooring (the wooden floor was very very squeaky and some of the pieces were about to come off!) and new curtains. The room itself was rather dusty - something you should expect of such an old hotel. The bed was quite bad - the mattress sagged. I had a very bad backache the next morning. All the hotel management could do was to put a wooden plank below the mattress, which didn't help much. So my advice is if you are fussy about the bed, don't stay in this hotel!
reviews.title: Top notch hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was surprisingly modern however, with a heated floor and all the usual amenities you would expect of a five star luxury hotel. The hotel provides Bvulgari toiletries, which were nice.
reviews.title: Awesome Hotel and Perfect location

reviews.text: Breakfast was generally good, with a sufficient range of continental breads and cereals with ham and cheese. The cooked eggs were well done.
reviews.title: Its Perfect
